alert.note: Alert for St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 19 at 12:03PM EDT until September 19 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following county, St. Lawrence. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1200 PM EDT, Doppler radar and spotter rain gauges indicated between 1.25 and 1.5 inches of heavy rain has fallen over the past 24 hours due to thunderstorms. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches is likely in the next 1 to 2 hours with flooding expected to begin in the next hour within the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gouverneur, Oswegatchie, Fowler, Degrasse, Star Lake, Cranberry Lake, Horseshoe Lake, Richville, Fine, Pitcairn, Edwards, Newton Falls, Lower Oswegatchie, South Russell, Aldrich, Wanakena, South Edwards, Shurtleff, Talcville and Fullerville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
